description: The SNMP notification that is generated when a module is installed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleInstalled KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleIndex u 9 KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleName s EXAMPLE KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleVersion s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: The index identifying a module entry. The name
not the index, is the primary key into the table. The index may
change with the device configuration, but will be as stable as
possible.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleIndex

description: The unique name of the module.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleName

description: The version of the module.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleVersion

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP notification that is generated when a module is uninstalled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleUninstalled KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleName s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: The unique name of the module.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleName

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP notification that is generated when a status point changes
state.

event.Summary: Status point $v5 in object $v4 changed state : $v7

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointChange KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointObjType i 1 KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointObjIndex u 9 KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointIndex u 9 KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointObjName s EXAMPLE KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointName s EXAMPLE KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointState s EXAMPLE KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointStateMessage s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: The type of object which contains status points.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointObjType

description: The index identifying the object of the specified type which has
status points. The object name, not the index, is part of the primary
key into the table. The index may change with the device
configuration, but will be as stable as possible.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointObjIndex

description: The index identifying this particular status point. The name
not the index, is the primary key into the table. The index may
change with the device configuration, but will be as stable as
possible.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointIndex

description: The unique name of the object containing status points within its
type.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointObjName

description: The unique name of this status point.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointName

description: The current state of this status point.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointState

description: The textual string that describes the current state of this status
point.
variables.name: KTXMODULE-MIB::ktxModuleStatusPointStateMessage

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP notification that is generated to indicate that the
status point table has been changed (i.e. entries have been added
and/or deleted.)

event.Summary: Status point table configuration has changed

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime
